SEARCH
Package org.example.services

Class ConfigService

java.lang.Object
org.example.services.ConfigService
public class ConfigService extends Object
Service class for loading and providing configuration settings.

The configuration is loaded from a config.properties file located in the classpath. This class provides access to key application settings, such as the maximum lifetime of shortened URLs and the minimum allowed click limit.

Default Values: If properties are not specified in the configuration file, default values are used: 24 hours for maximum lifetime and 6 clicks for minimum click limit.

Example Configuration File:


 maxLifetimeHours=48
 clicksLimit=10

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigService

      public ConfigService()
      Constructor that loads configuration settings from the config.properties file.

      If the file is not found or an error occurs while loading, an IllegalStateException is thrown. Default values are used if specific properties are missing.
